definition: pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
Thucydides trap (theory that war results when a dominant established power fears the rise of a rival power)
pinyin: Xiu1 xi1 di3 de2 xian4 jing3

sentences.english: Second, it helps you avoid the pitfalls of premature optimization in your migration.
sentences.chinese: 其次，它可以幫助您避免遷移過程中的過早優化陷阱。

sentences.english: For others, it can be a trap that can last forever.
sentences.chinese: 對於其他人而言，它可能是永遠走不出的陷阱。

sentences.english: Then proceed to the boiler, deal with the trap, and obtain another dull gray key.
sentences.chinese: 隨後走到鍋爐處，解除陷阱，取得另一枚塵灰色鑰匙。

sentences.english: You have fallen into the micromanagement trap.
sentences.chinese: 你已經陷到“微觀管理陷阱”裏了。

sentences.english: Your vision, and a proactive approach, can help you avoid this pitfall.
sentences.chinese: 長遠的眼光和積極的方式能助你避免跳入這種陷阱。

sentences.english: He will not see your one side, vast bump of the hurl enter the trap of the love.
sentences.chinese: 他不會見你一面，就莽莽撞撞的投進愛情的陷阱。

sentences.english: The deer was beguiled into a trap.
VTP trap is disabled by default.
sentences.chinese: VTP的陷阱默認情況下禁用。

sentences.english: He discovers ancient temples with long lost treasures and menacing traps.
sentences.chinese: 他發現與失散多年的珍品和險惡陷阱古剎。

sentences.english: He who digs a pit for others, falls in himself.
sentences.chinese: 想坑別人的人，跌進自己掘得陷阱裏。

sentences.english: Lots of people fall into the trap of thinking that a parent's drinking is only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 很多人掉入“父母喝酒只是暫時的”這樣的思維陷阱。

sentences.english: Have you fallen into this trap?
That sharp bend is a death-trap for motorists.
sentences.chinese: 那個急轉彎是開汽車的人的死亡陷阱。

sentences.english: DON'T fall into the trap of wearing ugly footwear just because it's comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 掉入舒適而難看的鞋子陷阱。

sentences.english: They are combined with the advanced deliberative module and successfully resolve the problem of local energy trap.
sentences.chinese: 通過慎思規劃解決了複雜環境下的局部勢能陷阱問題。

sentences.english: She is a legendary huntress whose traps are works of art.
sentences.chinese: 她是充滿傳奇色彩的獵者，其陷阱是個藝術品。

definition: a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
